item.description: The operator has announced multiple nuclear partnerships to secure reliable, scalable power sources ahead of surging AI-driven energy demands.

item.title: Hungary’s bet on EV battery boom hits bumps in the road
item.description: Prime Minister Viktor Orbán wants to turn his country into a European battery hub, but environmental opposition to factories and stagnating EV demand threaten the plan The post Hungary’s bet on EV battery boom hits bumps in the road appeared first on Climate Home News.

item.title: COP30 host Brazil drops support for plastic products ban in new global pact
item.description: Diplomats at UN plastics talks told Climate Home that Brazil's positions have been more aligned with major oil producers during the current round of talks in Geneva The post COP30 host Brazil drops support for plastic products ban in new global pact appeared first on Climate Home News.

item.title: Capacity Constraints Are Holding Back Big 3 Cloud Vendor Growth
item.description: Google, Microsoft, and AWS are all growing cloud revenues, but a lack of capacity to meet increasing demand is holding them back.

item.title: Brazil insists it will host COP30 in Belém, despite accommodation worries
item.description: A document sent to COP bureau members by the Brazilian hosts says the UN talks will stay in the Amazon city of Belém and argues enough beds are available The post Brazil insists it will host COP30 in Belém, despite accommodation worries appeared first on Climate Home News.

item.title: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has put weapons makers back in responsible investment funds
item.description: Europe’s push to rebuild its defence sector is prompting some values-based investors to rethink military exclusions The post Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has put weapons makers back in responsible investment funds appeared first on Corporate Knights.

item.title: After floods and failed harvests, Korean farmers sue state power utility for damages
item.description: Six farmers are seeking compensation from South Korea's KEPCO, arguing its fossil fuel emissions have contributed to economic and emotional harm The post After floods and failed harvests, Korean farmers sue state power utility for damages appeared first on Climate Home News.

item.title: Deadlock in UN plastics talks raises fears of watered-down deal
item.description: During a webinar hosted by Climate Home in Geneva, Panama's climate envoy said his country would reject a weak deal that ignores the growing production of plastics The post Deadlock in UN plastics talks raises fears of watered-down deal appeared first on Climate Home News.

item.title: Perplexity accused of scraping websites that explicitly blocked AI scraping
item.description: Internet giant Cloudflare says it detected Perplexity crawling and scraping websites, even after customers had added technical blocks telling Perplexity not to scrape their pages.

item.title: Sustainability Goals Are Set—So Why Aren’t They Being Met? Closing the IT Operations Gap
item.description: Many companies have set ambitious IT sustainability goals, but progress is lagging. Learn what’s holding teams back and how smarter infrastructure, executive alignment, and lifecycle strategies can help close the gap.
